thread.title: Taylor Swift fans warned about fake tickets for this weekend's concert
thread.title_full: Taylor Swift fans warned about fake tickets for this weekend's concert

title: Taylor Swift fans warned about fake tickets for this weekend's concert
text:
Taylor Swift fans warned about fake tickets for this weekend's concert UPDATED 7:19 PM CDT Oct 08, 2015 
The Omaha Metropolitan Convention and Entertainment Authority released information Thursday that fake Taylor Swift concert tickets have been circulating in the area. Related 
According to a police report, a former MECA employee is under investigation for printing and selling fake tickets. 
Swift is scheduled to perform Friday and Saturday at the CenturyLink Center starting at 7:30 p.m. 
"Taylor Swift is the hottest show in the country right now," said spokeswoman Kristi Andersen. "Unfortunately, people take advantage of that." 
Those who have already purchased tickets from a third party need to check their tickets. 
Andersen said they are investigating fake tickets printed with the CenturyLink Center's logo. 
KETV spoke with one victim who paid $600 for four tickets from someone who placed an ad on Craigslist. 
"I looked them over, they appear very legitimate, and he even gave me a customer receipt ticket that they gave him when he purchased them," said Swift fan Jessica Gillett. 
If anyone has tickets for this weekend's Taylor Swift show with seats in the 100 Level and the CenturyLink logo on the ticket , they could be fraudulent and MECA wants to hear from you. 
To check a ticket, contact http://omahameca.com/ or visit the box office inside the venue at 455 N. 10th Street. The box office is open from 10 a.m. to 6 p.m. 
MECA encourages people looking to buy tickets to purchase them from an authorized source such as CenturyLink, Ticketmaster and Ticketmaster retail outlets. Tags taylor swift concert tickets meca century link centurylink 
MAYBE AN UMBRELLA IF YOU'RE HEADED OUT THIS EVENING, 61 DEGREES AT 9:00. MELISSA? MELISSA: THANKS, BILL. TAYLOR SWIFT FANS, DOUBLE-CHECK YOUR CONCERT TICKETS. OFFICIALS AT THE CENTURY-LINK SAY SOMEONE PRINTED AND SOLD AND NOW, ACCORDING TO A POLICE REPORT, A FORMER MECA EMPLOYEE IS UNDER INVESTIGATION. TONIGHT, WE SHOW YOU HOW TO VERIFY YOUR TICKET. AND THE STORY OF ONE WOMAN WHO GOT SCAMMED. HERE'S KETV NEWSWATCH 7'S AMANDA AMANDA: UNFORTUNATELY, IT HAPPENS ALL OVER THE COUNTRY -- TICKET SCAMS AT HUGE CONCERTS. NOW, THERE'S A WARNING IN OMAHA, ESPECIALLY IF YOU HAVE A GOOD SEAT. ? CAUSE BABY, NOW WE'VE GOT BAD BLOOD ? AMANDA: NOW, SOME FANS CAN RELATE TO THIS FURY. JESSICA: WAITED UNTIL THE LAST MINUTE, AND SAID, HEY, LET'S DO TAYLOR SWIFT. IT'S GOING TO BE A GREAT CONCERT. AMANDA: BUT IT'S A CONCERT SEE. HER TICKETS ARE FAKE. JESSICA: THEY EVEN HAVE TICKETMASTER.COM PRINTED BEHIND THE LETTERING AND THE WORDING. AMANDA: SHE FOUND THE AD ON CRAIGSLIST, MET THE GUY, AND PAID CASH. $600 FOR FOUR TICKETS. JESSICA: I LOOKED THEM OVER. THEY APPEARED VERY LEGITIMATE. AND HE EVEN GAVE ME A COSTUMER RECEIPT TICKET THAT THEY GAVE HIM WHEN HE PURCHASED THEM, HE SAID. AMANDA: THEN, SHE SAW THIS WARNING ONLINE -- BEWARE, SCAM, WITH THE SAME PHONE NUMBER SHE CALLED. GILLETT'S NOT THE ONLY FAN TO FALL VICTIM. KRISTI: TAYLOR IS THE HOTTEST SHOW IN THE COUNTRY, EASILY. AMANDA: KRISTI ANDERSEN WITH THE CENTURY-LINK CENTER SAYS THE SCAMS ARE EVERYWHERE. NOW, POLICE ARE INVESTIGATING KRISTI: WE WANT THEM TO CLOSELY LOOK AT THOSE TICKETS. IF THEY'RE PRINTED ON OUR STOCK, WITH THE CENTURY-LINK CENTER LOGO ON THEM, WE WANT TO HEAR FROM YOU. THOSE TICKETS COULD BE STOLEN OR FRAUDULENT. AMANDA: JESSICA TOOK HER TICKETS GAVE HER THIS LETTER. THE BAR CODE, REJECTED. A LITTLE LESS "BAD BLOOD." AND A LITTLE MORE "SHAKE IT OFF." JESSICA: MAYBE WE'LL JUST DRIVE BY CENTURY-LINK. BUT WE STILL INTEND ON GOING OUT AND HAVING A GOOD TIME. AMANDA: AGAIN, IF YOUR TICKET FOR TAYLOR SWIFT THIS WEEKEND IS IN THE LOWER BOWL AND HAS THE CENTURY-LINK CENTER LOGO ON IT, THE ARENA WANTS TO HEAR FROM YOU. GO TO KETV.COM. LOOK FOR THIS STORY. ALL THE DETAILS FOR CONTACTING THEM ARE THERE. WITH MORE COMPLETE COVERAGE, AMANDA CRAWFORD, KETV NEWSWATCH 7. MELISSA: AGAIN, ACCORDING TO A POLICE REPORT, A FORMER MECA EMPLOYEE IS UNDER INVESTIGATION FOR PRINTING AND SELLING FAKE TICKETS. NOW THERE ARE STILL SEATS OPEN , FOR THE CONCERT.
